decks.notes: This deck aims to create a powerful combo using Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to generate massive amounts of mana and pump up creatures with Blade of the Bloodchief. Emrakul, the Promised End serves as a finisher, while Writhing Chrysalis helps summon more creatures. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the board. Urza's Saga and Ancient Stirrings help find key pieces, while the land base includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Cavern of Souls to protect important spells. The overall strategy focuses on explosive combo potential and disruption.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents by controlling the board with removal spells like Unholy Heat, Wrath of the Skies, and Path to Exile. It also utilizes cards like Reprieve and Price of Freedom to protect its own threats and disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to gain card advantage and mana efficiency through Cleansing Wildfire and Galvanic Discharge. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful creatures like Solitude, Magmatic Hellkite, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury allows the deck to finish off opponents quickly once it establishes control. The mana base includes a mix of colored sources to support the deck's versatile spells.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and blink effects while slowly building up your own board presence. By utilizing creatures with powerful enter-the-battlefield abilities like Solitude and Flickerwisp, you can control the battlefield and gain incremental advantage over time. Additionally, cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional disruption to further disrupt your opponent's strategy. Overall, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan, ultimately leading to victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a high number of artifacts and utilize cards like Arcbound Ravager and Engineered Explosives to control the board. The deck also includes cards like Tormod's Crypt and Weapons Manufacturing to disrupt opponent strategies and provide additional utility. The deck aims to generate a lot of mana with cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, allowing it to play multiple threats in a single turn. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive plays and resource management to gain a strong advantage in the game.

The deck focuses on using lands such as Urza's Saga and Lotus Field to generate mana and trigger powerful combo plays with Primeval Titan and Amulet of Vigor. The goal is to quickly ramp up to play a Primeval Titan, fetch more lands, and then either win through a massive Scapeshift or by tutoring for key pieces with Green Sun's Zenith. The deck also includes versatile cards like Aftermath Analyst and Vexing Bauble to provide additional value and card draw. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with explosive plays and outvalue them in the long run.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of disruptive spells and efficient creatures like Death's Shadow and Psychic Frog. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Counterspell to strip away the opponent's resources and protect your own threats, while also utilizing cards like Fatal Push and Dismember to deal with opposing creatures, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck revolves around quickly filling up your graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and then reanimating them with spells like Goryo's Vengeance. Cards like Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog help you dig through your deck to find your combo pieces, while Ephemerate and Faithful Mending provide extra value and card advantage. Utilize your disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect your combo and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win the game by quickly getting a powerful threat onto the battlefield and overwhelming your opponent with its abilities.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. Cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker disrupt the opponent's spells and interactions, while creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to deal with threats. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and win by overwhelming the opponent with a combination of disruption and aggression.

This deck focuses on using a variety of aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage before they can effectively respond. It also includes a mix of powerful leyline enchantments to support the aggressive strategy and strengthen the overall board presence. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to multiple colors of mana for the diverse creature and spell selection. The inclusion of key legendary creatures like Phlage and Scion of Draco adds additional depth and power to the deck's threat potential.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's strategy using a combination of counterspells, card draw, and targeted removal. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to control your opponent's hand, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Cling to Dust to deal with threats on the board, you can slow down your opponent's game plan while building up your own resources. Additionally, using cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Subtlety allows you to gain card advantage and maintain control of the game.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. By consistently keeping the opponent off balance with cards like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Force of Negation, the deck aims to control the board while deploying powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Wan Shi Tong, Librarian. The deck also utilizes card advantage engines such as Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Dreams of Steel and Oil to out-value the opponent in the long game.

This deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and disruption to control your opponent's resources. By utilizing a combination of creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending, you can quickly apply pressure while keeping your opponent's threats at bay. The addition of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Quantum Riddler allows for additional disruption and control over the game. With a mix of removal, disruption, and aggressive threats, this deck aims to disrupt your opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays while slowing down the opponent's game plan with disruptive elements. By utilizing a mix of powerful creatures, removal spells, and disruptive cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy. Phelia and Phlage provide strong creatures backed up by counter spells and removal options like Prismatic Ending. The deck also includes cards like Quantum Riddler and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to keep the opponent off balance and create advantageous board states.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana with rituals and medallions, while utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability to copy spells and deal damage to the opponent. It also includes card draw and graveyard recursion with cards like Wrenn's Resolve and Past in Flames. The deck aims to cast multiple spells in a turn to build up storm count and eventually finish off the opponent with a lethal Grapeshot or overwhelming board presence. The land base is optimized for fetching with fetch lands and providing access to multiple colors of mana for flexibility in casting spells.

The key strategy of this UW Control deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By using cards like Solitude, Orim's Chant, and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans and prevent them from building up a board presence. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Prismatic Ending and Wrath of the Skies to deal with threats efficiently. With card advantage engines like Teferi, Time Raveler and Lrien Revealed, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and grind out a win over time.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on aggressively playing low-cost creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Monastery Swiftspear, and Slickshot Show-Off while using spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Mutagenic Growth to push damage through and control the board. Mishra's Bauble and Preordain provide card advantage and help keep the deck moving quickly. The goal is to maintain a fast tempo and apply pressure early in the game, using efficient burn spells to finish off opponents before they can stabilize.
